workflow_steps.title: Monitor Data Sources
workflow_steps.description: OpenClaw connects to your transaction database, risk management system, and audit logs via secure APIs. Monitors new entries in real-time, tracking transaction volumes, risk flags, and compliance triggers.

workflow_steps.title: Apply Compliance Framework
workflow_steps.description: Agent applies your regulatory framework rules (SOX, Basel III, GDPR, AML) to incoming transactions. Calculates risk scores, identifies threshold breaches, and flags items requiring attention based on your compliance policies.

workflow_steps.title: Generate Formatted Report
workflow_steps.description: Compiles flagged transactions, risk trends, policy exceptions, and recommendations into your compliance report template. Includes executive summary, detailed findings, supporting documentation references, and action items.

workflow_steps.title: Route for Approval
workflow_steps.description: Sends draft report to compliance officers via Slack with executive summary and PDF attachment. Creates review thread for feedback and approval. Tracks who reviewed, when, and any comments or required changes.

workflow_steps.title: Archive & Audit Trail
workflow_steps.description: After approval, timestamps final report, archives in document management system, logs all generation and approval steps for audit trail. Sends final version to required recipients and regulatory portals.

Best suited for organizations processing 10,000+ monthly transactions requiring SOX, Basel III, AML, or GDPR compliance reporting.
prerequisites: Read access to transaction database (PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQL Server, or REST API)
Existing compliance framework documentation (rules, thresholds, report templates in Word/PDF)
Slack workspace or email system for notifications and approval routing
Document management system (SharePoint, Google Drive, Box, or S3) for report archival
IT security approval for read-only database access and API integrations

faq.question: How long does implementation typically take?
faq.answer: Implementation takes 3-4 weeks on average: Week 1 for database integration setup and initial rule configuration, Week 2 for validation with 3-6 months of historical data to ensure accuracy, Week 3 for compliance team training and workflow customization, Week 4 for parallel run alongside your existing process. Most teams start with one compliance domain (e.g., AML monitoring) before expanding to additional frameworks.

faq.question: Does this replace our compliance team?
faq.answer: No‚ÄîOpenClaw handles the time-consuming data gathering, aggregation, and initial report assembly, but your compliance officers remain essential for reviewing findings, applying judgment to edge cases, and signing off on reports. Think of it as a tireless analyst that eliminates the tedious data work so your team can focus on risk assessment, policy decisions, and strategic compliance management.

faq.question: How does it adapt to regulatory changes?
faq.answer: When regulations change (new thresholds, reporting requirements, data fields), you update the rule configuration in OpenClaw's admin panel. The agent immediately applies new rules to all incoming data going forward. We provide a compliance rule template library that's updated quarterly with common regulatory frameworks (SOX, Basel III, GDPR, CCPA, etc.). For custom rules, your team can modify thresholds and logic without coding.
